fields.name: Brexit
fields.description: What are your views on Brexit?

fields.text: Do you think Brexit is more likely to make things better or worse for your friends, family and community?
Brexit will make things better
Brexit will make things worse
No change
Don't know
Do you agree with the motion passed at Conference that if the Government’s deal does not meet Labour’s tests, all Labour MPs should vote against it?
fields.guidance: (Labour’s tests say Brexit must: deliver for all nations and regions of the UK; defend rights and protections and prevent a race to the bottom; deliver the exact same benefits as the single market and customs union; protect our security; ensure fair management of migration; and ensure a strong and collaborative future relationship).

fields.text: Yes - all Labour MPs should vote against any deal which does not meet Labour’s tests
No - Labour MPs should be free to vote for the deal
Don’t know
Do you agree with the motion passed at Conference that a no-deal Brexit should be rejected as a viable option?
Agree – no deal is not viable and must be rejected
Disagree – no deal is viable and an acceptable outcome
Don't know

Assuming that Tory Brexit is voted down in Parliament, the Labour Party has said that as a first priority, there should be a General Election – so that the public can judge whether to support the Government’s plan for Brexit. Do you agree that all Labour MPs should vote to maximise the possibility of a General Election?
Agree – all Labour MPs should prioritise maximising the possibility of a GE
Oppose – Labour MPs should have a free vote
Don't know

In the event that there is no General Election, Conference has said that Labour must support all options remaining on the table including campaigning for a public vote. Do you support a public vote and, if so, in which circumstances?
I support a public vote remaining on the table <u>as an option if there is no general election</u>
I support committing now to a public vote <u>but only if there is no general election</u>
I support committing now to a public vote <u>in all circumstances</u>
I do not support a public vote
Don't know

With less than 6 months to go before the date upon which the UK is to leave the EU, the rights and status of EU citizens living in the UK, and UK citizens living elsewhere in the EU, remain uncertain. Will you add your name to this statement from Momentum making clear that you believe this situation is unacceptable and should be addressed as a matter of urgency?
fields.guidance:
"Protecting the rights of both those British citizens who live in the EU and EU citizens who live in the UK - our family, friends, neighbours, colleagues and workers in public services upon which people across the UK rely - should be a priority for the UK Government. This should be achieved by jointly committing with the EU to implement the citizens’ rights part of the draft Withdrawal Agreement: unilateral assurances by all sides are not sufficient to secure their rights.

"As members of the Labour Party committed to justice and human rights, we stand in solidarity with those EU citizens in the UK who are now facing uncertainty about their futures. We regret that the UK Government has not been able to resolve this issue before now and call upon it do so immediately as a matter of urgency".

fields.text: Yes – I support this statement
No – I do not support this statement
